alert.note: Alert for Mayes; McIntosh; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 23 at 4:17PM CDT until March 23 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Benton and Washington AR. In Oklahoma, Adair, Cherokee, Delaware, Mayes, McIntosh, Muskogee and Wagoner. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 417 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Springdale... Rogers... Muskogee... Bentonville... Tahlequah... Siloam Springs... Wagoner... Jay... Bella Vista... Lowell... Pea Ridge... Fort Gibson... Gentry... Tontitown... Gravette... Cave Springs... Decatur... Locust Grove... West Siloam Springs... Colcord... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
